active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the relative risks of phishing versus credential stuffing for SaaS ATO in hybrid cloud environments. How does Zero Trust Architecture address both, and what gaps remain? Support with real-world examples from sources like NIST SP 800-207.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in SaaS Account Takeover (ATO) Detection (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 002_Incident Response And Forensics > Incident 002_Detection and Analysis > 009_Cloud and Hybrid Environment Detection > SaaS Application Monitoring > SaaS Account Takeover Detection). Generate high-quality flashcards using the exact schema provided. Incorporate: - Learning objectives (span all Bloom's levels as listed). - Scaffolding layers (tag each card; progress from Foundation to Integration). - Active learning tie-ins (reference discussions/activities in explanations). - Voter consensus: Complete attack methods (phishing details, SIM swapping, etc.), detection techniques (anomalous IPs, UEBA, MFA fatigue), NIST ZTA, big picture (IR Detection phase, MTTD reduction), prior knowledge links (IAM). - Research: ATO definition, SaaS security, NIST SP 800-207 ZTA (never trust/verify, resource protection). Output ONLY in JSON array of flashcards, each as: {'front': '...', 'back': {'correct_answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'distractors_explained': [...], 'references': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'layer': '...', 'difficulty': 'easy/medium/hard'}}. Ensure distractors are plausible/misconception-based. Balance coverage. Make explanations pedagogical for university-level learning.
